description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the issue of missing endpoint protection policies on co-managed devices after applying a Configuration Manager update:

1. Reference the following short-term mitigation guides until a long-term fix is deployed:
   - Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager release notes on endpoint protection: [Release Notes](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/configmgr/core/servers/deploy/install/release-notes)
   - Known issue documentation for hotfix 2309: [Hotfix 2309 Known Issue](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/configmgr/hotfix/2309/25858444)
   - Known issue documentation for hotfix 2403: [Hotfix 2403 Known Issue](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/configmgr/hotfix/2403/26186448)

**Details**:
- This issue specifically affects devices managed by Microsoft Intune that updated to Microsoft Configuration Manager version 2403 or 2309 HFRU, resulting in the removal of endpoint protection policies.
- A fix is expected to begin deployment on May 13, 2024, and should resolve the issue by May 17, 2024. (LLM Synthesized)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that you have administrative rights to apply the short-term mitigations mentioned in the guides.
